p: Antibodies against CPV were found in 60.0 % of the samples, including 33 canids where seroprevalence in wolves reached almost 74 % ( Table 4 ). Nevertheless, evidence of a positive association was found between CPV seropositivity in wolves and the sample conservation status (Fisherâ€™s Exact Test, p = 0.001), where better preserved samples had a higher likelihood of detecting Ab. Among mustelids, the two sampled individuals of M. foina had been exposed to CPV.
